result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:22 AM Defendant Mark A Connerton in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Mark A Connerton.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Attorney Wolff is asking for a quick date before the Trial Court to address bail and he will file a formal bail motion today.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:19 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Mark A Connerton in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Mark A Connerton. Victim A appeared in court.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Paul F Reilly October 26, 2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark A Connerton
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-25-2022)
Prior: 520 E College Ave,#4, Waukesha, WI 53186

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services. Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision. The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS. Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

3:24 PM Defendant Mark A Connerton in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Mark A Connerton. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Attorney Gutierrez appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
